Reviews.Title: “Spotless hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Gertrude57
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this quiet, tastefully renovated hotel in side street just 5mins walk from main vaporetto stop on the Lido. Perfect if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Venice and recharge your batteries. Our room spotless with very comfortable beds and modern bathroom. All staff we met were polite, friendly and very helpful. Good buffet breakfast swiftly replenished by hardworking, smiling lady. Good choice of restaurants just a short walk around the corner. We particularly liked Trattoria Africa - good simple food and wine reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate hotel on lovely island”
Reviews.Author: WendyCardiff
Reviews.Content: I decided to go for a lido hotel after searching high and low for a reasonably priced hotel in the city that was en-suite and with good reviews. Couldn't really find much and the more I read the more I thought it would be nice to stay away from the hubbub of Venice and be near a beach. Like two holidays in one and commuting by boat each day ( only 10 mins) was part of the fun! Arriving was easy. Bought a 72 hr travel card in airport for 33euros each and took the number 5 bus to p. Roma (the main bus station). Don.t bother paying the extra 6 Euros form the express bus as it isn't necessary. Maybe save you 5 minutes tops but the number 5 is included in travel card and it only takes about 20 minutes to town ven with some local stops. Getting on the number 1 vaporetto and travelling den the Grand canal was the best way to arrive and get an idea of the city layout. Loved it. The hotel was very close to the ferry stop. About five mins down main st and then turn right. The hotel is in a quiet back street and lovely and quiet. The decor looks brand new. Desk staff checked us in and very friendly. The room was fine. Larger than most I'd seen but about average travelodge layout and size (but a lot more contemporary and stylish) however I had booked a superior room on Expedia deal so dd ask if it was a superior room as it didn't seem to have anything extra to it. They seemed confused by the question so think the night staff (after 7pm ish) maybe didn't understand English quite as well. Asked again the next morning and they said they would ask management so we didn't worry too much as room was fine and spotlessly clean. The next morning the lady on the desk said we had a largish room but not a superior one and she would reduce our stay by not charging for breakfast. I hadn't realised the expedia deal was room only so this was helpful. I was slightly disappointed as had booked it as a special wedding anniversary but at the nod of the day it was still a lovely room (315) and good value for Venice so didn't complain. There was free wifi (you need a code each day from reception) and breakfast room was never full for us and plenty to eat. Cereals, toast, yummy croissants, juice, eggs, ham, cheeses, usual continental stuff. The hotel also had pretty garden which would be lovely when weather a bit warmer. Restaurants on lido were much better food and value than venice. We ate twice at al do mati on main st and when we got a bit sck of pizza and pasta there was a lovely Indian/thali place called Buddha bar almost by the turn for the hotel which we'd recommend esp for vegetarians ( but they do plenty of meat stuff too). Would definitely return to lido and ths hotel. We spent be day hiring bikes and cycled all over the island. The Pine Forest and beach at far end of used was pretty. Hired bikes at 'lidon' just off main st at ferry end. Only 7.50 for bike each. Good value. No deposit req. just leave driving licence or passport. Loved Venice but loved having an escape route too. The vaporetto service was amazing. So easy to use and ultra reliable. Runs all night too but we didn't use it after midnight. We allowed 2 hours to get back to airport for flight home and that was easily enough as we took the faster 5.2 line back to p.roma. Hope this is useful. V.good value and immaculately clean hotel away from the madding crowd and rip off restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place!”
Reviews.Author: Becca D
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for a more wonderful place to stay while in Venice. Tucked away on Lido, Villa Pannonia provides the perfect escape away from congested Venice. Upon my arrival my boyfriend and I were immediately upgraded, I couldn't tell you to what but regardless was thrilled. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, going so far as to help me figure out transportation to the airport at 1 in the morning the night before my departure. Living in Italy for 2 months now I have learned not to expect customer service, but Villa Pannonia has been the exception. The place was elegant, extremely clean, and provided a great breakfast. I would highly recommend this wonderful establishment where you have venice at the tip of your figure without the ridiculous over-pricing and obnoxious crowds.

Reviews.Title: “I Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jyancy13
Reviews.Content: I am totally smitten with the Lido and Hotel Villa Pannonia in particular. We arrived in Venice 5 days prior to the Biennale where we would be sharing an apartment in the Dosodouro area close to Peggy Guggenheim and the Salute. The Lido was recommended for it's relaxed atmosphere and the Villa Pannonia as one of the best kept secrets. We couldn't agree more. It was a short walk from the vaporetti terminal and a seemingly world apart from the "madness" that is Venice. The Lido is wonderful. Bright, cheery, quiet and within walking distance of some of Venice's best restaurants sans the hordes tourists and sans the inflated prices. A great charmer and a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DoctorEm
Reviews.Content: Am amazing little hotel just 5 minute walk from the Lido waterbus station (access to Venice and other islands). Takes about 10 mins on the waterbus from the Lido to San Marco Square (waterbus leaves every 10 mins). Excellent value for money and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel has been newly renovated so all rooms are beautiful, clean and modern. As an added bonus, there is also free WiFi although you have to get a new username and password daily from the front desk. We offer some advice for the trip in general. Venice is very expensive but there are some ways to save money. Firstly from the airport, the main transport to Venice and the Lido is via the private waterbus company, Alilaguna. Airport to Venice or the Lido trips are 15 Euros per person (25 return) but you can get a travel card for the public transport system for much cheaper (e.g. 36 Euros for 72 hours) and this includes the bus from the airport to Venice, at this point waterbus service is available as part of the travel card. As you will most likely need the waterbus service unless you are taking water taxis which is quite expensive, it is worth buying a travel card at the aiport when you arrive to access the bus to get you to Venice. Travel on bus/waterbus from the airport to the Lido takes an extra 30 mins approximately relative to the Alilaguna boat service but will save you 25 Euros per person. On a final note about transport, we were very impressed with how efficient it was. We often sat outside and got some amazing pictures. We also recommend taking it around the island to get a good perspective of the island and points of interest. Other advice we offer is about eating out at restaurants, which can be very expensive. Many places have a cover charge as well as service charge of 12% for sit down service. The cover charge (coperto) is from 2-3 Euros per person. There are quite a few restuarants that do not charge this and makes the meal much more reasonably priced if you can find them. This information is written in the menu so take a look at the menu before sitting down to eat. Finally, beware of hidden charges everywhere, such as for using public toilets which cost 1.50 Euros per use. There is a Museum card that can be purchased for entry to some galleries and museums and this includes access to toilets (40 Euros for 7 days - no shorter option). But if you do not get this, make use of toilet facilities in restaurants and places like McDonalds (one of the few places to get coffee in a "to-go" cup). I know this sounds cheap but it is amazing how quickly you can find your money leaving your wallet. These are just a couple of tips that we discovered while there. We would strongly recommend Venice and the Villa Pannonia to anyone. It is expensive but is a beautiful city and worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Service was very bad”
Reviews.Author: KenValB
Reviews.Content: All I can say is the Service was very Bad. We were over charged and they not reason with us at all. We ended staying at a different Hotel due to the staff. I do not recomend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Kweebs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights on our honeymoon and loved it. Very clean and charming villa. Staff was very friendly and helpful. WiFi was a bit slow but not a big deal. Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. Easy water taxi ride to San Marco or wherever you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “clean, helpful staff, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: diana b
Reviews.Content: We spent three wonderful days in Venice and hotel pannonia was wonderful to come back to in the early evening. Away from the crowds and yet plenty restaurants nearby. A pleasant ferry ride each day to the centre to sightsee, yet a peaceful retreat to return to. I would reccomend Lido as best place to stay in Venice and hotel wonderful. Staff so helpful and hotel clean and bright. Breakfast was lovely and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Well located away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: sdouglas_11
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from three nights on the Lido. Most of the other reviews have said all the positives about the extremely helpful and pleasant staff, which they certainly were. It is a small boutique hotel with around 30 rooms. Great location for catching the waterbus (Vaporetto) to Venice and also the airport, but being away from the crowds at the end of the day, which was most welcome. When you disembark from the boat, head for the main street - 'Gran Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta,' walk about 300m down the right side of the road and the hotel is signposted off to the right, tucked behind the 'Grande Albergo Ausonia & Hungaria' on the main street. The rooms were both similar, but one with a lighter shower room (no baths) as had a window. Mine was dark and lacked shelving to put essentials. The bedroom was smartly decorated, but the dressing table/desk did not have a mirror on the wall. The nearest (only one) was a full length one on another wall. Not ideal for putting on make-up or doing hair, bearing in mind there was no where in the bathroom to put these items under the mirror. The towels were clean but thin. However, these are minor niggles. It was lovely and quiet and very comfortable. There were one or two small things which needed sorting and this was attended to immediately. It is worth mentioning our first breakfast on the Saturday morning was chaotic. Breakfast was served until 10.00 every morning and we went down at 9.30. The dining room which is small, was full and there was only one waiter (who was lovely and worked really hard) attending. The milk ran out, the water in the hot drinks machine for coffee etc., ran out and the orange juice (which is UHT not fresh) ran out too! It was a while before this was sorted. We went down half an hour earlier the next day and it was much better. Tip, if you want a good cup of coffee/cappucino, ask the waiter/waitress to get it from the machine at the bar, not the help yourself one, which dispenses all the tea etc and tastes poor. The former is superior and happily provided. It is a typical continental help yourself breakfast with cold meat, cheese, croissants, cake, small selection of cereals and hard boiled eggs. The only disappointment was the bread. There were only small hard bread rolls - no toast or sliced bread. There is a pleasant little patio garden outside too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean good location great service”
Reviews.Author: DanielleChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: While a ten minute boat ride from st marks, it is a very nice respite from all the noise and crowds of the main area of Venice Rooms clean and comfortable and staff is very helpful Great breakfast and plenty of restaurants close by Also short walk to the beach if you wanted that opportunity

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: daveh104
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very smart and very comfortable. Above our expectations for the price we paid particularly after looking at many other hotels in Venice which seemed extortionately priced. From the train the hotel is easy to reach, a Vaporetto ride and a short walk once on Lido. The hotel is on a quiet street tucked behind the main street where the life is and 5 minutes max to the Vaparetto stop. We didnâ€™t stay anywhere other then Lido but it seemed to us to be the perfect location. The hotel is modern with friendly and helpful staff. The attic room we had was large and had a big bathroom, both fitted throughout with all you need. Be warned that if the room is too hot or too cold when you arrive check the air conditioning, it can only be turned up or down in the room by a couple of degrees otherwise reception set it, which they immediately did for us. The breakfast was good with plenty of choice although nothing hot. All in all a very nice hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Cunillu
Reviews.Content: We stay 3 nights with 2 young kids, very quiet and clean hotel. We had the room in the roof, nice but the bathroom have narrow cover, if you are more than 180cm then pay attention at the roofâ€¦. The position is very convenient to visit Venice, we arrive by our car, and park it in the hotel, then just 5min walk to the ferry station, then within 15min we are in city center. In the night is charming to walk around the hotel, with few nice restaurant recommended by the friendly staff of the hotel Overall is good

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is way under rated.... or a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: one_lucky_guy-21
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel for 2 nights. I travelled with 4 other people and we had 3 rooms amoungst us. All 3 rooms were very nicely decorated. They were very clean and although not overly spacious, they were not compact either. We were not disappointed at all in the location. Lido has numerous boats and from the "bus stop" it is about an 8-10 minute walk to the hotel. Turn right out of the "bus stop" and the first street past the main street is Via Michiel Doge Domenico (there is also a sign saying Villa Pannonia... and pointing down the street). There are numerous places to eat nearby and Lido is a destination that anyone going to Venice should also visit. You almost forget you are in Venice since Lido is an island that has vehicles. It is the only island around Venice that does have vehicles. From the hotel, it is about another 6-10 minute walk to the beach. We were not here during prime time which I understand is quite hectic around Lido. This is a place where all the Italians go to get away. But back to the hotel.... the staff was wonderful! When we got there, they gave us a map of Venice, showed us some good places to eat, visit, and to explore. They helped us with our luggage to the rooms and made sure all was well. The rooms were decent size wise and very clean. The biggest disappointment was the size of the shower. In 2 of the rooms it was pretty tight. The other room the shower was much larger (room 321). The beds were comfortable, There was cable TV (if you really need to watch while on vacation) and the breakfasts in the morning were very good. They have a good spread of breads, cheese, meat, fruits, cereals, yogurt, and a coffee machine that offers expresso, cuppochino, tea, and more. This was a nice way to start the morning and fuel up for the day. I also recommend that you buy a 24-36-48... hour bus pass. You can hop on and off the "bus boats" and there are several which stop in Lido. This is also a great way to cruise the Grand Canal. It takes about 20-25 minutes from the train station/ piazza Roma to get to Lido. Again.... this hotel was great. We also went to Rome, Florence, and Pisa and this was voted our nicest place. It was also much more reasonable than many places.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, lovely staff and fantastic breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola1606
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Venice with my boyfriend on 2-5 April and we decided to stay on Lido after reading that it was quite hectic in Venice and Lido was a nice retreat. Also Lido was supposed to be cheaper for food etc. We landed in Treviso and found it really easy to get our bus ticket for the ATVO bus which took you straight to the Piazzle Roma where you can pretty much get a boat anywhere in Venice. We'd bought a pass for 33 Euro for 3 days from Venice Connected and I can't recommend this enough. Them money you will save is astounding. We hopped on the Number 1 which was quite a slow ride if you're wanting to get to Lido fast but it goes down the Grand Canal so you get to see the best bits of Venice. About 40mins later we got to Lido. As soon as you leave the vaparetto station go straight up the main street that you'll see infront of you, keep on the right hand pavement and walk up the road until you get to a very large, beautiful hotel with all kinds of artwork on it. Turn right at that hotel then left and you will see the Hotel Villa Pannonia on the right hand side. Check in was very swift, the lady on reception was absolutely lovely and spoke English very well! The rooms were a perfect size for the 2 of us and the bathroom was lovely! The shower was the best I've used in Europe and only coming second to a shower in Lake Tahoe. We arrived around lunchtime so decided to explore the island. We walked for ages and got a bit lost but it was all part of the fun and we easily found our way back to the front of the island again. I'd recommend going for a leisurely stroll, it's a much cleaner place to 'get lost' than Venice in my opinion. The food was a LOT cheaper than Venice and was lovely. The staff couldn't do enough for you and the Pizzeria's on the main street are the best! Venice is definitely a place to see but be cautious, unless of course you're prepared from previous trips, to pay over the odds at a lot of places. We went for a drink and pizza at a cafe on the front and ended up paying 43 Euros for 2 mini pizzas, a beer and a campari cocktail. Luckily we just found it funny but my boyfriend drew the line at sitting in St Mark's Square and paying 8 Euros 80c for a bottle of water plus 6 Euros each for the music cover charge! The Villa Pannonia was an excellent base for our stay, yes the breakfast was the same everyday but the selection was so varied you could stay a full week and not repeat yourself! I had croissants, proscuitto, ham and cheese with a glass of orange and a cup of green tea everyday. They had yoghurts, cereal, fruit, crackers, bread rools, Philly Cheese, Nutella, Honey, Jam, the list goes on! It filled us both until past lunchtime each day. On the last night we had dinner on Lido and the weather took an awful turn and started to thunder, lighten and rain so we retreated back to the hotel bar and we wished we'd done this every night. The lady on reception was so accomodating, explained to me what a Spritz was and when the barman left she even came and poured more drinks for us and topped up our bar snacks. And added bonus, the wifi, although I receievd a username and password on a piece of paper saying it would be 20 euros for 24 hours (broken down not just 1 day), was free! I cannot recommend this hotel or compliment their staff enough. If we come back to Venice we will be sure to stay on Lido and return to the Hotel Villa Pannonia. I know this is a very long review but I had so many nice things to say!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous! Perfect for Venice.”
Reviews.Author: ruun
Reviews.Content: Venice is busy, crowded, and very happening. To sleep in a hotel *in* Venice would be challenging, I'm sure, not to mention expensive. Venice is more expensive than Florence. Also, the more tourist centric a city, the less hygiene is followed in hotels. Fact. Lido is a 20 minutes ferry ride away from Venice. The ferry stops a 5 to 10 minutes walk away from Hotel Pannonia. The hotel is lovely. Lido is quieter and cleaner, and also very lovely. The hotel rooms are very modern and clean with lots of space, the bathroom has a clean shower (no tub, hurrah! [do you want to lie in a tub a million strangers before you have shared?]) and nice soaps etc. Overall, the hotel is perfect. The staff was very very friendly and sweet to us. The breakfast was in a big room and full of people in the morning (evidently, despite seemingly quiet and exclusive, the hotel is quite popular). We were received at check-in by a very sweet lady and an adorable young man who were incredibly helpful with what to do in Venice, the ferry ride, etc. My only concern in hotels, no matter how perfect and charming, is hygiene. We were on a Europe trip and in every hotel we stayed in, the bedsheets had evidence of not being 100% clean. In Pannonia, there was small hair on the sheets. However, you can stay in a palace that is also a hotel, and you will encounter the same issue. Perhaps housekeeping in Europe is not paid or trained well? I recommend taking 1 bedsheet with you to lie / sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed at in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: SSMcCoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our last 2 nights in Italy (of an 8 day trip) at Villa Pannonia. It was so refreshing to stay in a modern, clean, and spa-like hotel. Our room was on the attic floor, which was about average size with a soft and cushy bed. The bathroom, however was quite spacious with a shower that was like heaven compared to the other hotels on our trip. The breakfast was wonderful with fresh pastries, meats, cheeses, and an assortment of juices. The location is on the island of Lido, which is only a 10 minute boat ride to St. Mark's Square. When we arrived at the train station in Venice, we immediately boarded the #1 vaparetto and toured the Grand Canal. Lido is the last stop from this boat and from the dock, it was less than a 5 minute walk to the hotel. It was very easy to find. While people may be hesitant to stay away from the main tourist attractions, don't be because the crowds in main Venice were unbearable. It was great to see the sites, return to Lido, and then return back to St. Mark's Square for dinner after the day trippers have left. Lido was great to hang out in and of itself. The hotel is located near a pedestrian area with shops, bars, cafes, and also the beach. We spent 2 nights at Villa Pannonia and didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “very modern and unique”
Reviews.Author: whatsinaname50
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but praise for this little gem of a hotel. The staff could not have been more welcoming and helpful. Our room was spacious and modern. The shower was a little tricky but we fiqured it out. Breakfast was adequate - maybe a little more attention could be directed towards a variation of the selections. Do not stay in Venice if you don't have to. Lido is quiet, relaxing and has a wonderful feel about it. Swim in the Adriatic Sea like the locals, eat in a outdoor cafe, watch street performers, and best of all indulge in gelato. Your Euro/dollar will go futher in Lido.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: karla014
Reviews.Content: As my first time in Venice, I wasn't aware that Venice is formed by several islands, and that the main one, is the one that everybody knows. When I booked this hotel, I choose it mainly because it was one of the few that could accommodate my family of four in one room, and because it looked nice and had good reviews. Well, to my surprise, Lido is so beautiful, that we almost didn't want to go to the main island. We had a great time there, the hotel is charming, it is a remodeled summer house of a noble European family, it has a combination of old world charm with contemporary touches. We were given an "attic" room that was spacious and clean, the bathroom was not huge but ok, very nice gardens, breakfast was standard, and good service. Overall we had a very good experience. But the great thing is Lido itself. It has a nice beach, you can rent bikes and ride around town, lots of restaurants and cafes, beautiful gardens, this place is worth staying here, so you can "visit" Venice and go back to your hotel in Lido to rest and enjoy the scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and warm staff!! Helpful frontdesk!”
Reviews.Author: Loveastro
Reviews.Content: All the people in the frontdesk are great, and the manager is a nice and helpful lady. The room is very comfortable, and the bathroom is spotless. Even the free shampoo is quite good. The lobby for breakfast is well-decorated, elegant and artistic. During our stay there was a gallery exhibition in the lobby, although we missed it but it should be quite nice. However, besides all the facilities, what was best was its crew, they couldn't be more helpful to us! I will definitely recommend this hotel. Yet it would have been even better if it had free internet connection within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: velouba
Reviews.Content: Very quiet hotel on the Lido. All renovated. Our suite was spacious and bedding of very high quality. Little down side : the windows on the second floor are a bit high. Modern deco, lacking maybe a touch of color in room. Extremely helpful staff for any advice you may require. You feel welcome and comfortable at once. Very good breakfast (fresh orange juice would be great). A few minutes walk from Vaporetto (direct 15 min to San Marco or else 30 min "cruise"). Hope to be back soon !

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel. Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: ivankcl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with my wife and our 2 1/2 year old. The hotel had excellent service and very friendly staff. Rooms were very spacious and new, with a modern decor. The bathroom was new and nicely done. Overall it was very cosy. The only problem was that I could not have a shower standing (and I am only 184cm tall) since the bath tub was below the low end of the ceiling. Nevertheless, I recommend the hotel for stays in Venice. It is only a 15 minute boat ride from Piazza San Marco, and a great way to escape the confusion and crowds in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: samanthajaneleigh
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant stay in this hotel, came with a group from college for the Venice Biennale 2009 so it was booked by lecturers and not myself. I was expecting something less fancy to be honest. It is very modern (chic) and the rooms are basic, designed to a high standard and very clean. (If you were looking for somewhere a bit cosy, historical or romantic this hotel would not really be the one.) The staff were all very nice, I asked for spare blankets/pillows and the man at the front desk couldn't have been more helpful. There is no bar but this was not a problem as I prefer to discover bars etc. outside of hotels. The breakfast was amazing and there was a large selection to choose from. Note: If you suffer from motion sickness I would recommend staying in Venice centre rather than Lido as it is an extra 30 min boat ride there and back each day. I would definitely come back to stay in this hotel!!! Hope this comes in helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucifercat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel twice. In fact the second time we deliberately chose to stay here as we had been so impressed on our first visti. We will be visiting Venice again in 2009 and I am trying to book this hotel again. It has everything. Clean comfortable, friendly staff, location really good as it is very easy to get into Venice about 10 to 15 mins by waterbus to St. Marks Square - depending on which one you catch and the waterbuses run round the clock so no problem if you want to spend a night in Venice and come home late. Restaurants on the Lido very good. Also you do not pay silly money to stay here as it is a little off the tourist trap route.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the stay here”
Reviews.Author: k374
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when I was in Venice in summer '06 so it's a while back but I wanted to post a review nonetheless. I highly recommend this hotel if you're on a budget (and who isn't :). Staying in Lido has the benefit that you get to enjoy breakfast in the Main St. of Lido which is a gorgeous place by itself and then the beautiful vaporetto ride into Venice each morning. The hotel is very close 10 min. walk to the water taxi station and there are many restaurants near the hotel, including an internet cafe and a mini shopping mart. What makes the hotel awesome is the value for money. The rooms were basic but clean, the bathroom was nice size and not cramped which I liked and the showers and everything worked great. The staff was SUPER friendly and always willing to help. They even told me where I could find a automatic laundry in Venice (there is only one in the entire city and it would've been difficult to locate if not for the directions because it's tucked away in some alley).

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: Timetraveller1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant. The staff were on top form, very helpful and whilst we arrived very late on our first night, it was in very easy walking distance (no need for a taxi) from the water bus terminus and were able to still purchase a drink from the bar. The rooms were comfy with nice views and this hotel was definately good value.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Villa Pannonia- Daniel was great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladyinmaryland
Reviews.Content: For Spring Break this year we stayed here while spending 2 days in Venice. The hotel is the last stop on the #1 Route of the vapretto. This is great because on your way here you get to see all of venice. The hotel is in a quaint residential district which makes it nice because very little tourist mark-up. However, this is a drawback if you don't speak Italian. But, my 11 year old son and I managed. The hotel offered clean accomodations, a good breakfast and friendly staff. Take the 2.50 Euro tour to Murano. It's a bargain. Daniel was excellent and very efficient!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “my view of the Villa Pannonia.”
Reviews.Author: dollydimple
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villa Pannonia on the Lido in June 05. Location is good, about a 5 minute pleasant walk from the vaporetto stops and plenty of shops, restaurants etc in the area. I did elect to get a taxi from the vaporetto stop,costing 5 euros, well worth it, as I was feeling tired after my journey from UK. The hotel is basic but clean. I was on the 3rd floor - a long way to climb stairs with heavy bags - as there is no lift. Had a double room, single occupancy, at a good price.The shower in the bathroom was one of the best - powerful and hot - great after all the walking and exploration of Venice during the day! There is a small bar area - a bit faded but functional - but no lounge area. It was pleasant sitting in the gardens with a relaxing drink and daydreaming.... The hotel served breakfast and evening dinner was optional. Breakfast was buffet continental but plenty of variety and ample. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Room facilities were basic but clean.The tv remote control came in useful - not for changing channels as the batteries were dead - but gave me that essential extra couple of inches to reach the buttons on the TV manually!!! The telephone was on a shelf above the bed. As the flex was not very long, if you wanted to use the phone, you could not take it off the shelf and had to stand on the bed to reach and use it.There was no safe in the room but valuables can be put in the hotel safe. One annoying aspect was that the room lock was very temperamental and only locked after several attempts. Other guests had similar problems too,as you could hear them struggling with their keys!! Would I stay here again? Location was good, staff good, price was good. Probably would do but may try a hotel on the main island in Venice next time. Of course, if I did that, I would miss the wonderful water bus ride and grand entrance into Venice. The journey is an unforgettable experience itself and within about 12 - 15 minutes, you can be in St. Mark's Square. Travel to and from the Lido is frequent so no worries there. Hope this has been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A group of 9 of us stayed in August 2004. We found the hotel to be clean and basic. Staff efficient but not overly friendly. Some of us had air conditioning and some had fans. Good position for visiting Venice, about 12 minutes by waterbus to St Marks Square and a 5 minute walk to the beach. Plenty of bars 5 minutes walk. Overall would stay again if visiting Venice.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Villa Pannonia
HotelInfo.Address: Via Doge Domenico Michiel 48, 30126 Venice, Italy
